result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin J Ludwig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied.  Fine paid in full.

Cash bail applied.  Costs paid in full.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

11:14 AM Defendant Benjamin J Ludwig in court.  Attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse in court for Benjamin J Ludwig.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for plea and sentencing. 
Defendant has completed AODA assessment. State places offer on the record.
Court conducts plea colloquy. 

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. 
State and Defense make sentencing recommendations. 
Defendant makes statement to the court. 

Court orders the following:	
Fine:  $804.25
DNA Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Payment of Fine/Forfeiture/Costs/Surcharges:  To be paid in 30 days. Civil judgment to be entered as penalty for non payment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Case was set for plea and sentencing.
Defendant requests a little more time to complete requirements for amendment of charge.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defense request more time to complete treatment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:09 AM Attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse in court.   Defendant Benjamin J Ludwig did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Voge, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.
Defendant has companion case in the city of New Berlin.
Case should resolve and State has made an offer to amend.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
